segment.source: How to Create the Package Root Directory
segment.target: How to Create the Package Root Directory

segment.source: How to Create the Package Root Directory
segment.target: How to Create the Package Root Directory

segment.source: How to Create the Package Root Directory
segment.target: How to Create the Package Root Directory

segment.source: The package root directory is the directory on the computer running the App-V Sequencer where files for the sequenced application are installed.
segment.target: The package root directory is the directory on the computer running the App-V Sequencer where files for the sequenced application are installed.

segment.source: This directory also exists virtually on the computer to which a sequenced application will be streamed.
segment.target: This directory also exists virtually on the computer to which a sequenced application will be streamed.

segment.source: You should create the package root directory before you monitor the installation of a new application.
segment.target: You should create the package root directory before you monitor the installation of a new application.

segment.source: After you have created the package root directory, you can begin sequencing applications.
segment.target: After you have created the package root directory, you can begin sequencing applications.

segment.source: For more information about sequencing a new application, see How to Install the Sequencer.
segment.target: For more information about sequencing a new application, see How to Install the Sequencer.

segment.source: To create the package root directory
segment.target: To create the package root directory

segment.source: To create the package root directory, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, map the Q: drive to the specified network location.
segment.target: To create the package root directory, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, map the Q: drive to the specified network location.

segment.source: The location you specify should have sufficient space to save the application you are sequencing.
segment.target: The location you specify should have sufficient space to save the application you are sequencing.

segment.source: To create a directory that you can use for a new virtual application, create a folder on the Q: drive and assign it a name.
segment.target: To create a directory that you can use for a new virtual application, create a folder on the Q: drive and assign it a name.

segment.source: The name you assign to virtual application files that will be saved in the package root directory should use the 8.3 naming format.
segment.target: The name you assign to virtual application files that will be saved in the package root directory should use the 8.3 naming format.

segment.source: The file names should be no longer than 8 characters with a three-character file name extension.
segment.target: The file names should be no longer than 8 characters with a three-character file name extension.

segment.target: Tasks for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
